publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1110 Christine Grahame: Borders Railway Funding-That the Parliament, in respect of the recent statement by John Prescott that £60 billion is earmarked for railway investment over the next ten years, in implementation of the Parliament's commitment to reinstating the Borders Railway from Edinburgh to Carlisle in terms of motion S1M-922, and given the Executive's commitment to social inclusion and sustaining rural economies, to moving freight from road to rail and to reducing urban congestion, calls upon the Scottish Executive in its directions and guidance to the Strategic Rail Authority and in bidding for funds to ensure that this rail link has priority.
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Colin Campbell*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-1110 Christine Grahame: Borders Railway Funding-That the Parliament, in respect of the recent statement by John Prescott that £60 billion is earmarked for railway investment over the next ten years, in implementation of the Parliament's commitment to reinstating the Borders Railway from Edinburgh to Carlisle in terms of motion S1M-922, and given the Executive's commitment to social inclusion and sustaining rural economies, to moving freight from road to rail and to reducing urban congestion, calls upon the Scottish Executive in its directions and guidance to the Strategic Rail Authority and in bidding for funds to ensure that this rail link has priority. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Colin Campbell, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robin Harper, Mr Adam Ingram, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Alex Neil*

S1M-1110 Christine Grahame: Borders Railway Funding-That the Parliament, in respect of the recent statement by John Prescott that £60 billion is earmarked for railway investment over the next ten years, in implementation of the Parliament's commitment to reinstating the Borders Railway from Edinburgh to Carlisle in terms of motion S1M-922, and given the Executive's commitment to social inclusion and sustaining rural economies, to moving freight from road to rail and to reducing urban congestion, calls upon the Scottish Executive in its directions and guidance to the Strategic Rail Authority and in bidding for funds to ensure that this rail link has priority. Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Colin Campbell, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Robin Harper, Mr Adam Ingram, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Michael Matheson*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1110 Borders Railway Funding (lodged on 24 July 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
